meanings.definition: A Christian festival celebrating the resurrection of Jesus Christ, held on the first Sunday after the first full moon following the vernal equinox.
meanings.sent1: During the paskhas, many people attend church services to celebrate Jesus' resurrection.
meanings.sent2: My family gathers for a special meal on paskhas Sunday to mark the occasion.
meanings.sent3: At the paskhas celebration, the children enjoyed an egg hunt in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of renewal during paskhas is like a fresh bloom after a long winter.
meanings.sent5: The church bells rang joyfully on paskhas morning, announcing the start of the festival.

meanings.definition: A type of sweet bread traditionally baked and eaten during the Easter season.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's homemade paskhas is a family favorite during Easter.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sells delicious paskhas loaves during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked paskhas filled the kitchen, tempting everyone.
meanings.sent4: The golden crust of the paskhas gleamed like the sun on a spring morning.
meanings.sent5: Each slice of the sweet paskhas was a delightful treat for the taste buds.
